ssim_interpretation.description: Structural Similarity Index (SSIM) measures how similar two images are. A value of 1 means the images are identical, while a value closer to 0 means they are very different.
ssim_interpretation.interpretation: The SSIM value of 0.33 indicates low similarity between the original and tampered images.

pixel_differences_interpretation.description: Pixel-wise difference shows the absolute difference between the two images. Bright areas in the difference image indicate regions where the images differ significantly.
pixel_differences_interpretation.interpretation: Check the 'pixel_diff.jpg' image to see where the original and tampered images differ. Bright areas indicate tampering or changes.

ela_interpretation.description: Error Level Analysis (ELA) highlights areas of an image that have been compressed differently. These areas may indicate tampering.
ela_interpretation.interpretation: Check the 'original_ela.jpg' and 'tampered_ela.jpg' images. Bright areas in the ELA images suggest regions that may have been altered.

heatmap.description: The heatmap visually represents tampered areas. Bright red and yellow indicate heavy modifications, while blue/green indicate minimal changes.

comparison_image.description: The comparison image places the original, tampered, and highlighted versions side by side to easily spot alterations.

tampering_percentage.description: This value represents the percentage of the image that has been altered. A higher percentage means more modifications were detected.

conclusion.description: Based on the analysis, the tampered image shows differences in the following areas:
conclusion.final_verdict: The image appears to be altered.
